results.title: Big Questions Remain About White House Plan to Speed Formula to Shelves
results.abstract: A day after invoking the Defense Production Act to help alleviate a nationwide shortage, administration officials had few answers for how the law would lead to more supply.

multimedia.caption: President Biden on Wednesday authorized the use of the Defense Production Act in an effort to increase baby formula supply.

results.title: As he runs in the G.O.P. primary for Georgia Senate, Herschel Walker says he wants a ban on abortion with no exceptions.
results.abstract: On Wednesday, Mr. Walker called for more money to promote adoption and to support single fathers and single mothers.

results.title: The Senate overwhelmingly approves $40 billion in aid to Ukraine, sending it to Biden.
results.abstract: The measure’s relatively smooth path through Congress has reflected a broad consensus on Capitol Hill, for now, to devote massive sums to supporting Ukraine’s war effort.
results.byline: By Emily Cochrane and Catie Edmondson

multimedia.caption: A home was destroyed by Russian forces in Vilkhivka, Ukraine. The Senate gave approval to the largest foreign aid package passed by Congress in at least two decades.
multimedia.copyright: Finbarr O'Reilly for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: A home was destroyed by Russian forces in Vilkhivka, Ukraine. The Senate gave approval to the largest foreign aid package passed by Congress in at least two decades.

results.title: Census Likely Miscounted the Population of 14 States, a Review Finds
results.abstract: A survey indicated that census takers in 2020 undercounted the number of people in six states, mostly in the South, and overcounted in eight others. Covid is among many possible reasons.

multimedia.caption: Miami Beach, Fla., in April. Results of a survey indicate that residents of Florida, Arkansas, Tennessee, Mississippi, Illinois and Texas were likely undercounted by the 2020 census.
multimedia.copyright: Cristobal Herrera-Ulashkevich/EPA, via Shutterstock

results.title: G7 Finance Ministers Race to Secure More Ukraine Aid
results.abstract: Officials are working on a plan to provide $15 billion to help keep Ukraine’s government operating during its war with Russia.

results.title: U.S. Aims to Cripple Russian Oil Industry, Officials Say
results.abstract: The revenue powers Vladimir V. Putin’s war machine in Ukraine. But plans for new U.S. sanctions could create problems with China, India and other major buyers.
results.byline: By Edward Wong and Michael Crowley

multimedia.caption: Gazprom Neft’s oil refinery in Moscow. New restrictions on Russian energy sales have greater potential for long-term damage to the country’s economy.

results.title: Racists Once Terrorized This Georgia County. Diversity Made It Prosper.
results.abstract: The slow return of diversity to an area that brutally drove out its Black residents has been accompanied by a boom that gives the lie to “Great Replacement” conspiracy theories.

multimedia.caption: Cumming, Ga., is in Forsyth County, where the population is now over 260,000 — up from 45,000 when the vestiges of all-white Forsyth began falling away.
multimedia.copyright: Audra Melton for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Cumming, Ga., is in Forsyth County, where the population is now over 260,000 — up from 45,000 when the vestiges of all-white Forsyth began falling away.
multimedia.copyright: Audra Melton for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Cumming, Ga., is in Forsyth County, where the population is now over 260,000 — up from 45,000 when the vestiges of all-white Forsyth began falling away.

results.title: The 17th-Century Judge at the Heart of Today’s Women’s Rights Rulings
results.abstract: Both in India and in the Roe v. Wade draft ruling roiling the United States, Lord Matthew Hale — an English judge who wrote that women were contractually obligated to husbands — still looms large.

multimedia.caption: The 17th-century English jurist Lord Matthew Hale was cited in a recent Supreme Court draft opinion that would overturn Roe v. Wade.
multimedia.copyright: Universal History Archive, via Getty Images

multimedia.caption: The 17th-century English jurist Lord Matthew Hale was cited in a recent Supreme Court draft opinion that would overturn Roe v. Wade.
multimedia.copyright: Universal History Archive, via Getty Images

results.title: House, Acting After Buffalo Rampage, Moves to Combat Domestic Terrorism
results.abstract: Democrats advanced the legislation on a nearly party-line vote, but with Republicans opposed, it faces an uphill battle in the Senate.

results.title: Biden Invokes Defense Powers in a Bid to Ease Formula Shortage
results.abstract: The president invoked the Defense Production Act to boost supply and directed federal agencies to use Defense Department planes to speed shipments of formula from overseas.
results.byline: By Annie Karni and Emily Cochrane
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

multimedia.caption: Lawmakers have raced to respond to the frustrations and pleas for help from desperate parents who have struggled to feed their children amid the shortage of formula.

results.title: Republican Panic Grows After Mastriano Wins
results.abstract: G.O.P. strategists reacted to the victory in Pennsylvania with alarm, worried that he may be too extreme for voters in an otherwise promising year for their party.

results.title: Midterm Stakes Grow Clearer: Election Deniers Will Be on Many Ballots
results.abstract: In primaries so far, Republican voters have appeared willing to nominate proponents of Donald Trump’s election falsehoods, making clear that this year’s races may well affect future elections.

multimedia.caption: Doug Mastriano, now the Republican nominee for governor of Pennsylvania, sitting with his wife, Rebecca, at a recent rally in Lehighton, Pa. Mr. Mastriano led the charge to overturn President Biden’s victory in his state.
multimedia.copyright: Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images

multimedia.caption: Doug Mastriano, now the Republican nominee for governor of Pennsylvania, sitting with his wife, Rebecca, at a recent rally in Lehighton, Pa. Mr. Mastriano led the charge to overturn President Biden’s victory in his state.

results.title: A Panel to Combat Disinformation Becomes a Victim of It
results.abstract: The Department of Homeland Security suspended the work of a panel focused on the subject of disinformation. The group had provoked accusations of government overreach.

results.title: A federal appeals court says the S.E.C.’s use of an in-house judge violates defendants’ rights.
results.abstract: The ruling by an appeals court covering Texas, Louisiana and Mississippi applies only in that territory, but it’s the latest challenge to the way the agency handles enforcement actions.

results.title: Justice Dept. Employees Urge Administration to Grant Leave for Out-of-State Abortions
results.abstract: The request for federal employees to be granted time off to travel out of state for the procedure comes as large companies are starting to make accommodations in the area.

multimedia.caption: Justice Department employees asked the Biden administration to consider the move after a leaked draft opinion showed that the Supreme Court was poised to overturn Roe v. Wade.

results.title: A Michigan election denier who was parodied by ‘S.N.L.’ is disqualified as a candidate.
results.abstract: Melissa Carone, who was enlisted by Rudolph W. Giuliani to testify at an election oversight hearing, made a false statement on a candidate affidavit, state officials said.

results.title: Group Seeks Disbarment of Ted Cruz Over Efforts to Overturn 2020 Election
results.abstract: A group trying to hold lawyers accountable for their efforts to keep Donald Trump in power after his election loss filed a complaint against the Republican senator with the Texas bar association.

multimedia.caption: The complaint focuses on Senator Ted Cruz’s involvement in lawsuits seeking to reverse Donald J. Trump’s loss in Pennsylvania and comments he made about election fraud.
